97439.section: Prepare a qPCR master mix (in a DNA-free preparation hood)
97439.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9cgme","text":"Thaw qPCR reagents and samples on the bench, flick to mix and briefly spin down on a tabletop centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e941a","text":"Transfer the plate into the thermal cycler after setting it up appropriately and carry out qPCR reaction at the following conditions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rqjv","text":"95 °C for 00:10:00  ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5gle","text":"95 °C for 00:00:10 ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3qe2","text":"62 °C for 00:00:30 ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ev24","text":"Repeat steps 2-3 50cycles (Fluorescent products were detected once every cycle, at the end of the extension phase)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42qb1","text":"40 °C for 00:00:10 ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

97439.section: Set up a qPCR plate (in a PCR template addition hood)
97439.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"110uh","text":"Aliquot 15 µL of master mix to each well of a 96-well PCR white plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kgt8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jrv8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8lb9t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9060h","text":"Mix master mix frequently while pipetting, and ensure each well's contents are mixed properly.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

97439.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"beald","text":"Prepare a master mix for the number of qPCR reactions, plus negative controls, positive controls (written per reaction):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvlgv","text":"10 µL 2x LightCycler 480 probes master (DMSO)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ea755","text":"1 μM Bcc forward primer and 1 μM Bcc reverse qPCR master mix is a solution that has all of the components for a qPCR reaction except the template or control DNA.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1if69","text":"Prepare the master mix in the biosafety hood.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ffkce","text":"All the reagents and master mix should be kept on ice during the preparation.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1qckc","text":"Make sure to account for pipetting errors and make slightly more master mix than needed (add extra 1-2 reactions).","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

97439.section: Prepare a qPCR master mix (in a DNA-free preparation hood)
97439.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e6qhp","text":"Gently mix by inversion and briefly centrifuge to collect the liquid at the bottom of the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eoosk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

97439.section: Set up a qPCR plate (in a PCR template addition hood)
97439.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"flpqc","text":"Add 5 µL of each DNA sample, or 5 µL of gDNA of B. cepacia DSM7288 104 GE/reaction (for positive control), or 5 µL of nuclease-free grade water (for negative controls) into appropriate wells of the 96-well PCR white plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":48,"length":10},{"style":"sup","offset":69,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98r2f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ncjc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"286oc","text":"Samples should be run in at least duplicate, but preferably triplicate.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7el1i","text":"Keep a detailed plate map of wells containing DNA samples and positive and negative controls.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

97439.section: Set up a qPCR plate (in a PCR template addition hood)
97439.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"atoj2","text":"Seal the plate thoroughly with optical plate sealing film, and centrifuge briefly at low speed to ensure the contents of the wells are at the bottom. Try to remove any bubbles by gently tapping the plate against the bench and spinning again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jd9b","text":"Data analysis:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ksab","text":"Once qCPR experiment is complete, analyse the result using the LightCycler 480 software to obtain threshold cycle (Ct) signals from each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kj7n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a4lq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c83k2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bko7t","text":"To determine the quantity of Bcc GE detected in each qPCR reaction, each positive result is quantified from the obtained Ct values and compared to the established Bcc qPCR NAD calibration curve: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbqu6","text":"y=-3.224x + 39.46 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":8,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mmg8","text":"where x is the log10 of the starting quantity and y is the Ct value.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":50,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":18,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn8uo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8588u","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"qbue","text":"Check that the correct filter combination has been chosen to correspond with the probe used in the experiment, e.g. HEX (for Bcc assay), or CY5 (for IAC assay). ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":2,"offset":20,"style":"sup"}],"key":"f2g37","text":"Positive control, 104 GE/reaction, is expected to amplify between Ct 26 and 27. Failure to satisfy this quality control criterion is a strong indication that the experiment has
been compromised. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e6k7q","text":"IAC signal should be detected in all samples except for the non-template control sample. IAC Ct values of 31-33 are within the normal range. ","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avhcu","text":"Turn on the LightCycler‱ 480 machine and the attached computer. Login to the computer and the designated software (LightCycler 480 software) using the login details on the computer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"83EC3BB574B011EEB7700A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"801kj","text":"Here we present a rapid (\u003c4 hours from sample in to result out) culture-independent Bcc NAD method, incorporating a quantitative real-time Polymerase Chain Reaction (qPCR) assay. This method can be used to detect and simultaneously identify the Bcc species directly from water samples. This culture-independent Bcc NAD method is validated to the testing method equivalent of the ISO/TS 12869:2019 standard (a widely used rapid culture-independent NAD method for detecting Gram-negative Legionella species in water) in terms of specificity, sensitivity, accuracy and turnaround time to result compared to Bcc microbial culture diagnostic methodologies.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":486,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmdq","text":"We propose that the rapid culture-independent Bcc NAD method presented could gain widespread acceptance and be applied as a valuable diagnostic tool supporting a water risk management strategy in the pharmaceutical sector to assure the safety and quality of these water systems and water used for manufacturing.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7163u","text":"The development and validation of this culture-independent Bcc NAD method has been published in: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24nmk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5vapl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"align":"","authors":"Duong H, Fullbrook S, Reddington K, Minogue E, Barry T","can_edit":true,"date":1688169600,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.5731/pdajpst.2021.012728","guid":"99DFC7377EA54E0D8731890EA051F13A","id":0,"journal":"","protocol_guid":"","protocol_id":0,"title":"Design, Development, and Validation of a Culture-Independent Nucleic Acid Diagnostics Method for the Rapid Detection and Quantification of the Burkholderia cepacia Complex in Water with an Equivalence to ISO/TS 12869:2019."}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"cfmrj","text":"The laboratory workspace and equipment were sterilized by UV-light, DNase solution, and 70% ethanol. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5sov0","text":"Due to the sensitivity of the assays, extra care must be paid to avoid sample contamination during analysis, and as such Good Laboratory Practice must be followed. Wear laboratory coats and gloves at all times.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ku1d","text":"Filter pipet tips were used in all steps of the laboratory work.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bc20k","text":"The material to be used (tubes, tips, water, etc.) must be free of nucleases.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Burkholderia cepacia complex, water testing, culture-independent, nucleic acid diagnostics, qPCR
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"cvtge","text":"Filtration apparatus (mounted either on an air pump or on a vacuum flask), suitable for sterilization by steam (autoclave)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kqj7","text":"Filter funnel has visible graduations that are appropriate to the volumes of the sample typically analysed (should be sterilized by autoclaving before use)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1pnj","text":"A vacuum pump provides a pressure which permits the suction of filtration through the membrane filter","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fqp2","text":"A vessel to collect the filtered water (e.g. 1 litre bottle)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20ls1","text":"Sterile forceps for handling membrane filters","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fl0h1","text":"0.4 µm hydrophilic polycarbonate membrane filters of 47 mm diameter (Isopore membrane filters, Merck Millipore) with a low absorption capacity for extracellular nucleic acids using a vacuum pump. The membrane filters shall be sterilized. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2oe8h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3138b","text":"Quick-gDNA‱ MiniPrep Kit (Zymo Research)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"align":"","authors":"Majaneva M, Diserud OH, Eagle SHC, Boström E, Hajibabaei M, Ekrem T","can_edit":true,"date":1521158400,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-018-23052-8","guid":"E887D59B1D474E71822FC40C9112B034","id":0,"journal":"","protocol_guid":"","protocol_id":0,"title":"Environmental DNA filtration techniques affect recovered biodiversity."}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"60147EF474C011EEB7700A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"a456d","text":"1. Duong HT, Fullbrook S, Reddington K, Minogue E, Barry T. Design, Development and Validation of a Culture-Independent Nucleic Acid Diagnostics Method for the Rapid Detection and Quantification of the Burkholderia cepacia Complex in Water with an Equivalence to ISO/TS 12869:2019. PDA Journal of Pharmaceutical Science and Technology. 2023. doi:10.5731/pdajpst.2021.012728","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":202,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"223ev","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7oo56","text":"2. ISO 12869:2019 Water quality — Detection and quantification of Legionella spp. and/or Legionella pneumophila by concentration and genic amplification by quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR). 2019.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54c3k","text":"3. Barry, T.; Reddington, K.; Minogue, E. A Method for the Detection of Legionella. WO 2018/065497 Al, April 12, 2018.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dtm3u","text":"Water preparation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccupv","text":"Water is collected in a sterile container containing sterile 0.1% v/v sodium thiosulfate pentahydrate solution to inactivate any residual disinfectant chlorine (if needed) and immediately used for experimental analysis upon arrival in the laboratory (within approximately 2 hours of collection).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5b9ur","text":"Ethanol-flame sterilise the forceps and, with them, remove the sterile membrane filter from its packaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ee13","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d78h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4tutj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dkvji","text":"To sterilise forceps, dip forceps in alcohol and flame in an alcohol burner. Cool\nbefore use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rarq","text":"Place the sterile hydrophilic polycarbonate membrane filter on the sterile membrane filter base of the filtration apparatus, taking care that only the outer edge of the membrane filter is grasped with sterile forceps.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fsrih","text":"Fit the sterile funnel securely on the filter base of the apparatus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2euvm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55rgc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c2c8j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dkvji","text":"Do not touch the inside of the funnel.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"mk2b","text":"Flame the pouring lip of the sample container and pour the desired volume of test water sample to be studied (e.g. 100 ml) into the funnel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7lltj","text":"Turn on the vacuum pump (pressure differential of 30-50 kPa (kiloPascals)) and allow the complete separation of filtrate through the membrane filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clspc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"358qm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"sknu","text":"It may be advisable to rinse the funnel's interior with one to three 10 ml to 30 ml portions of sterile water while the filter is still in place to remove organisms adhering to the funnel.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"qhhs","text":"Power off the vacuum pump and remove the funnel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"en5ds","text":"The funnel may be re-used without disinfection for the same sample so that the smallest volumes and/or the most diluted samples are filtered first. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f1hm","text":"To filter another sample, a separate sterile apparatus shall be used, or where appropriate, the funnel can be disinfected by rinsing the funnel with at least 100 ml of sterile water and then with alcohol to prevent cross-contamination.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cobbd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ds22q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1j09r","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5cr1q","text":"In every batch of experiments, always include a processing control sterile water confirmed to be free of Bcc, to be used as a negative control to indicate any contamination during the process.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3cnov","text":"Add 2 ml of Genomic Lysis Buffer of the Quick-gDNA MiniPrep Kit to each filter in the 20-ml tube and incubate at room temperature on a rolling platform for 30 mins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bb71o","text":"With ethanol-flame sterile forceps, carefully remove the membrane filter and aseptically place the membrane filter into a prepared sterile 20-ml tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jjbr","text":"The remainder of the DNA extraction and purification protocol follows steps 2-4 of the section \"Cell Suspensions and Proteinase K Digested Samples\" from the Quick-gDNA MiniPrep Kit (Zymo Research) manufacturer’s instructions to extract total gDNA.\nhttps://files.zymoresearch.com/protocols/_d3024_d3025_quick-dna_miniprep_kit.pdf","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":248,"length":80}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0CE27CF974C411EEB7700A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://files.zymoresearch.com/protocols/_d3024_d3025_quick-dna_miniprep_kit.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"airlt","text":"Transfer the spin column to a clean microcentrifuge tube. Add 25 µl nuclease-free water to the spin column. Incubate 5 minutes at room temperature and then centrifuge at top speed for 30 seconds to elute the DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8u0oj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ddbfj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2tvdf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e9j2i","text":"It is advisable to incubate the column with resuspension solution for 5 minutes to increase DNA yield. Centrifuge again; the eluted DNA in solution is collected in the tube, and the column is discarded.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e0nfv","text":"The eluted DNA can be used immediately for molecular-based applications or stored at ≤-20ºC for future use.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ff5j5","text":"The column is transferred to a new tube and centrifuged again at maximum speed for 1 minute to ensure the complete removal of remnants of the washing solution from the column before DNA elution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7ulv","text":"The eluted DNA samples are used as templates in the previously described Bcc qPCR NAD assay. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4mhh","text":"Link:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e88tb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4iplr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":97439,"title":"The Bcc qPCR NAD assay for the specific rapid quantitative detection of all Bcc species","title_html":"The Bcc qPCR NAD assay for the specific rapid quantitative detection of all Bcc species","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"the-bcc-qpcr-nad-assay-for-the-specific-rapid-quan-dbd72i9n","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Huong Duong","affiliation":"University of Galway","affiliation_url":null,"username":"huong-duong","link":null,"image":{"source":"/img/avatars/009.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/009.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":9},"type_id":1,"guid":"FDF7EDC4EC1511EEB26F0A58A9FEAC02"}}}}

title: The culture-independent Bcc NAD method for the rapid detection and quantification of Bcc in water
